Louis Stewart - Irish Jazz Legend

Home Bio
Bandcamp SoundCloud
Videos Photos Equipment Media

Gibson Super 400

At 18" across the lower bout, this is one of the largest production guitars made. Known for its deep, round sound, Louis used this guitar on many albums, recordings, and life performances. This guitar currently belongs to John Etheridge.

1950s Gibson ES-175

Louis frequently used this guitar towards the end of his career. A much smaller instrument than the Super 400, the ES-175 is one of the most popular archtop guitars used by jazz, pop, and rock musicians.

Ibanez 2471 (lawsuit guitar)

Louis was pictured with this guitar on the cover of Milesian Source, an album influenced by fusion such as Pat Martino's Joyous Lake

Peterson P100G

A rare UK-made amplifier which Louis used in the 80s. Can be seen in the Youtube video Louis Stewart - Live at JJ's (1990)

Aer

A popular amplifier for acoustic and archtop guitars.
